calendar.description: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Hearing

general_provisions: This bill addresses civil actions in the district court.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>grants the attorney general an unconditional right to intervene in a civil action in the district court upon notice that a party is challenging the constitutionality of a statute;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Utah Supreme Court has exclusive and original appellate jurisdiction over a judgment or order from a panel of three district court judges;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the attorney general, the governor, or the Legislature may file a notice to convene a three-judge panel in a civil action in the district court;<hr><ltbullet>requires a panel of three district court judges to be convened to hear and decide a civil action upon the filing of a notice to convene a district court panel;<hr><ltbullet>requires each judge of a district court panel to be randomly selected and from a different judicial district than the other judges on the panel;<hr><ltbullet> addresses the structure and voting process for a district court panel;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the statutory venue requirements for a civil action do not apply to an action before a district court panel;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Judicial Council to create a rule regarding the random selection process for a judge on a district court panel;<hr><ltbullet>addresses staffing of a district court panel; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
